story:
It’s that time of year agin when I’m taking part in Quit for a bit for Alzheimer's Society. 

Every pound I raise will help someone living with dementia, including my Dad who is suffering from this debilitating and cruel disease. 

Watching someone you love dearly, become a different person, who doesn’t know themselves any longer is horrendous, there needs to be more awareness, funding and research to support more patients and families who are suffering as we are. 

Thank you for reading this and if you can spare a few pounds to help, I’d be so grateful, as would dad.

charity.name: Alzheimer's Society
pageSummary: I'm quitting alcohol and sugar because I know I can change my lifestyle
pageSummaryWhy: I know I can change my lifestyle
story:
I'm taking part in Quit for a Bit for Alzheimer's Society for one significant reason, my Mum.

Diagnosed five years ago, Mum's Vascular Dementia has rapidly declined following a series of falls in Spring this year. Her behaviour has changed dramatically, with Sundowners Syndrome now presenting itself, causing more confusion for the sufferer and deep frustration for the carer and family. Watching a loved one's memory and cognitive functions slip away is heartbreaking. I may not be able to change what is happening to Mum, and we may never find the reasons Dementia occurs, but I can change my life for 30-days to raise awareness and much-needed funds to help.

The Quit for a Bit Ultra Challenge means I will be quitting sugar and alcohol for November. Anyone who knows me well will know that this will be a tough challenge. But I'm also doing it for myself. The last two years have been extremely tough on my mental health for numerous other reasons, and my diet and lifestyle have suffered. I need to do this for both Mum and me.

I know that it's not an easy time to ask people to give money, but every pound I raise will help someone living with Dementia.

Thank you for sponsoring me!

pageSummary: We are raising money because we want to honour Reiner /Opi
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page for Reiner. 

Alzheimer’s Society is here for everyone affected by dementia.

By 2025, 1 million people will be living with the condition in the UK, and many millions more carers, partners, families and friends are affected.

Lack of treatments and postcode lottery for care means that people with dementia and their families aren’t getting the support they need, when they need it.

We will not rest until people with dementia and their carers live more fulfilled and less fearful lives, free from stigma and inequality.

Our supporters ensure that people living with dementia today have the support they deserve, that their rights are protected and enhanced by campaigning, and that they can look to a brighter future thanks to investment in research.
title: Remembering Reiner
image.caption: NA
media.images.image.caption: NA
rememberedPersonSummary.name: Reiner  Hegmann

charity.description:

charity.name: Alzheimer's Society
pageSummary: I am giving up booze for November because I like a challenge.
pageSummaryWhat: I am giving up booze for November
story:
I'm taking part in Quit for a bit for Alzheimer's Society. I am signing up today, 26 October,  on what would have been my dad’s 83rd birthday. He was taken from us after a lengthy struggle with dementia and it was a massive wrench not to mention a challenge for myself and family to see him slowly slip away. Week after week, month after month his memory would deteriorate and mercifully, the end, unlike many others, came before he failed to recognise us. 

Many times he would say: “I don’t know what’s wrong with my head!” But we knew, and if we can prevent anyone from having to go through what we endured, or make their struggle easier in some way, then it has to be worth the effort.

Mrs F will be taking part too and if you know us then you’ll also know what a massive challenge this will be. I need a drink just thinking about it!!

So please give what you can in these straitened times. Every pound I raise will help someone living with dementia. Thank you for sponsoring me!

story: I'm taking part in Quit for a Bit for the Alzheimer's Society. Every pound I raise will help someone living with dementia. I know so many families who have lived with this awful condition, including my own, and I am doing this in memory of my beautiful Nana (who loved to shower us with chocolate and treats and would think I’m barking mad). Thank you for sponsoring me!

pageSummary: I’m doing a 5 miles Swim for Dementia in one week because I wanna raise awareness and £250.
pageSummaryWhat: I’m doing a 5 miles Swim for Dementia in one week
story:
Alzheimer’s Society is transforming the landscape of dementia forever.Until the day a cure is found, the society will create a society where those affected by dementia are supported and accepted, able to live in their community without fear or prejudice.

My mum Selina is living with dementia and is the reason I have taken this challenge. There are few times that she is tragically cheerful and fun but most times it’s difficult to witness and experience. There are also many who are suffering from this condition and it will be super helpful if we can all donate in order to change lives. I’ve challenged myself to do this 5 mile swim for dementia in a week in order to raise awareness of this condition and to raise some funds towards the work being done by Alzheimer’s Society. Please donate any amount to this worthy cause. I hope to raise £250.

Thank you for all your support.

story: Zoë says: I have decided to ‘quit for a bit’ as I feel I need the personal health challenge right now, and doing it to raise awareness and money for Alzheimer’s UK is the perfect reason! My version of the challenge will be to quit alcohol, sweets, biscuits, chocolate and, most challenging for me, crisps…. I will give myself one day back ‘on’ to celebrate Martyn’s birthday!

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

story:
Hi folks. I am completing this challenge to raise money for Alzheimer's Society. Dementia is a cruel illness that takes away the ones we love before they are truly gone. I hope this little contribution will go towards helping those suffering from dementia and those who are caring for them. The Challenge is to complete 100 pushups a day for each of the 30 days of November. Wish me luck.

For Mum and Dad

pageSummary: Running Cardiff half marathon for Alzheimer’s because This is a charity that is very close to my heart
pageSummaryWhat: Running Cardiff half marathon for Alzheimer’s
pageSummaryWhy: This is a charity that is very close to my heart
story:
So this year I have decided to run the Cardiff half marathon to raise money for the Alzheimer’s. 

The Alzheimer’s society is a charity that is very close to my heart. Many people are not aware that my grandmother was diagnosed many years ago. It is an awful illness to have and can have a massive impact on the lives of the individual and their families. 

I would like to thank all the carers who look after my  Gran on a daily basis and hope that one day a cure will be found. 

Alzheimer’s Society is transforming the landscape of dementia forever.Until the day we find a cure, we will create a society where those affected by dementia are supported and accepted, able to live in their community without fear or prejudice.

pageSummary: Paul and Kate are running because it's very close to our hearts
pageSummaryWhy: it's very close to our hearts
story:
Picture the scene …

I’m at Denbies wine estate with my little sis (Kate Scott) enjoying a small tasting glass of local wine - our 2nd of the day. It’s sat 18th Jun 2022 and the sun is shining, its a beautiful day.

No, we weren’t on a wine tasting visit, rather this was just a short interlude - 1 of 23 - interspersed between running 24 times around a 1-mile loop of the vineyard over a 24hr period - the infamous “P24 Longest Day” Race! It was great fun, tiring, hard work (especially in the middle of the night when the wind, rain & lightning picked up!) but we managed lots of laughs, met some lovely people & sampled a couple of wines :)

So it’s a bit late to ask for money for an event from nearly 5 months ago I hear you say! Well, you’re right, but during said event (possibly before it got very hard & after I’d had a glass or 2!) I said to Kate that I needed another goal after this - something else to “look forward” to. Ha! So we signed up to the Ranscombe Autumn Challenge: http://www.saxon-shore.com/ranscombe_autumn/ … run as many loops of the c.3.75mile circuit as possible in 8hrs!

Why why why why? Because we’re crazy.

Kate has done this (& several other “ultras”) before, but apparently they don’t really get any easier! And for me, it’ll be my first. Up until about 3 weeks ago I’d never run more than a 1/2 marathon distance. But, our goal is to get to 50km (31.08miles) - officially an “ultra”.

So far the training has gone well (apart from a couple of short-term minor injuries for us both), but we’re up to 18-20 mile training runs, so fingers crossed!

We decided to run in aid of the Alzheimer’s Society. A very very worthy cause; a cause which sadly has recently started to affect our family and something which is also sadly all too common in today’s world.

Whilst we’re very aware of the challenges facing everyone today with an unprecedented cost of living crisis, we would be immensely grateful if you could spare any amount - however small - to our cause. It would mean a lot to us.

With lots of love & thanks,

The mad siblings
X



Alzheimer’s Society is transforming the landscape of dementia forever.Until the day we find a cure, we will create a society where those affected by dementia are supported and accepted, able to live in their community without fear or prejudice.

pageSummary: I am raising money because it is a charity very close to my heart.
pageSummaryWhy: it is a charity very close to my heart.
story:
Ready, Set, SNOW! I'm unleashing my inner elf to support people affected by dementia and I need your help! 

My Grandad was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s/Vascular Dementia in 2020. As a family, we have seen the devastating consequences this illness can have and we want to do everything we can to raise vital funds to help with further research and support.

We will all, in some way, be affected by dementia in our lives and it is so important that we help in any way that we can! 

By dressing as elves/wearing our Christmas jumpers on this day, together I know we can raise money for this important cause! 

Every donation, no matter how small, will be greatly appreciated! 

Thank you so much,

Miss Andrew

THANKYOU  GAIL

story: support people affected by dementia.This cruel disease is a taker of people's personalitys, it robs people of their memories, it causes confusion, distress, depression, and at its worst psychos. If I can raise awareness of its affects on how it destroys peoples lives at least it has been useful for understanding how we can move forward to finding a way to make life easier for people struggling with this disease. Jayne.

story:
Who said accountants have to be serious all the time.  Last year we had numerous elves walking/dancing around the building! 

We try to do a couple of charity events each year and who wouldn't want to dress up as an elf to raise some much needed funds for a great charity.  Alzheimer's can affect absolutely anyone whether it's you or a loved one.  

Get out those elf ears and start donating.

pageSummary: Running SW dressed as an Elf because We need to raise more awareness 💜
pageSummaryWhat: Running SW dressed as an Elf
pageSummaryWhy: We need to raise more awareness 💜
story:
As everyone knows I have done Elf Day/week before in memory of Nan and Pa to raise money for Alzheimer’s Society and to raise awareness of Dementia.💜

Well I’m doing it again this year and  in a weeks worth of Slimming World groups on the 6th, 8th and 10th of December 🎄

Please help support me this year - every penny adds up and will help go to a good cause that needs our support.

Many thanks - Steph  xxx

Alzheimer’s Society is transforming the landscape of dementia forever.Until the day we find a cure, we will create a society where those affected by dementia are supported and accepted, able to live in their community without fear or prejudice.

pageSummary: I am running a half marathon on 11th December
pageSummaryWhat: I am running a half marathon on 11th December
story:
I am running for the Alzheimer’s Society as my uncle has recently been diagnosed with early-onset Alzheimers at the age of 58.             

The Alzheimer’s Society are a vital source of support and a powerful force for change for everyone affected by dementia.  By 2025, 1 million people will be living with the condition in the
UK, and many millions more carers, partners, families and friends are
affected. Lack of treatments and postcode lottery for care means that people with dementia and their families aren’t getting the support they need, when they need it. The Alzheimer's Society ensures that people living with dementia today have the support they deserve, that their rights are protected and enhanced by campaigning, and that they can look to a brighter future thanks to investment in research.
title: Lizzie's Half Marathon (ATW Christmas Nottingham Holme Run)

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my mum's JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

pageSummary: This is for all the cats that need our help 😻 because What would the cats do without their hard work.
pageSummaryWhat: This is for all the cats that need our help 😻
pageSummaryWhy: What would the cats do without their hard work.
story:
When my cat was lost cats protection are they ones who brought her back to me. She was looked after whilst i was making poster's and trying hard to find her. Will forever be grateful for that 🥰 

Cats Protection is the UK’s leading feline welfare charity. Our vision is a world where every cat is treated with kindness and an understanding of its needs. Cats Protection has simple and clear objectives to help cats:Homing - Finding good homes for cats in needNeutering - Supporting and encouraging the neutering of catsInformation - Improving people’s understanding of cats and their careAchieving this vision is only made possible due to kind cat lovers who support our work. Visit www.cats.org.uk for more information.

pageSummary: I am running the London Marathon April 2023 because cats need us to keep them safe, happy and healthy.
pageSummaryWhat: I am running the London Marathon April 2023
pageSummaryWhy: cats need us to keep them safe, happy and healthy.
story:
One evening, I was tapping away on Insta stories and the chance to run the London Marathon with my favourite cat charity popped up. I’d never particularly run very far before but I wholeheartedly believe cats need our protection and, in these hard economic times, more than ever. So I thought, ‘Why not!’ and clicked to apply without hesitation. Obviously I never expected to get in!!! 😉 Then the next day I got an email to say I had a place and I’ll be honest, I’ve spent the last month trying to work out if I have the capacity for it. I’m recovering from a nasty injury and going through so much house moving stress that I wasn’t sure this was my time. But then my husband bought me a second hand treadmill and everything started to fall into place with the new house that I thought… why not!? Cats need us - people like me, keen and mad enough to run some 26 miles for them, and people like you to follow the training story and give generously to our feline friends.

Thank you for your donation and getting behind us. Gandalf will be cheering from the sides and I’ll be running for Cats Protection in April 2023 with all your support! 😽

Cats Protection is the UK’s leading feline welfare charity. Our vision is a world where every cat is treated with kindness and an understanding of its needs. Cats Protection has simple and clear objectives to help cats:Homing - Finding good homes for cats in needNeutering - Supporting and encouraging the neutering of catsInformation - Improving people’s understanding of cats and their careAchieving this vision is only made possible due to kind cat lovers who support our work. Visit www.cats.org.uk for more information.

charity.description: Cats Protection is the UK's leading feline welfare charity. We help around 200,000 cats and kittens every year through our network of  250 volunteer-run branches over 30 centres. We find homes for cats, promote the benefits of neutering and produce a wide range of cat care information for owners.
charity.name: Cats Protection
story:
Cats Protection is the UK’s leading feline welfare charity. Our vision is a world where every cat is treated with kindness and an understanding of its needs. Cats Protection has simple and clear objectives to help cats:

Homing - Finding good homes for cats in need
Neutering - Supporting and encouraging the neutering of cats
Information - Improving people’s understanding of cats and their care

Achieving this vision is only made possible  due to kind cat lovers who support our work. Visit www.cats.org.uk for more information.

eventName: Walk for Home Organise your Own
story:
I am taking part in Walk for Home for Shelter this December to fight homelessness & unite against the housing emergency.

Thousands of people across the UK are going the distance this winter. It's been a difficult year & things have really hit home. But your sponsorship will do incredible things from supporting people whose jobs & homes are under threat to campaigning for a stronger safety net for everyone.

The money raised will help Shelter campaign to end rough sleeping, build more social homes & protect renters who face discrimination and eviction:

£10 could pay for two webchats of online support and advice.

£20 could pay for two calls through our emergency helpline.

£80 could pay for two face-to-face advice sessions.

£120 could pay for a legal advice session for someone facing housing problems.

£150 could help someone keep their home resolving a complex housing issue for them.

Thank you for making a big difference!

charity.name: Shelter
story:
Hi folks!

Thanks for visiting my JustGiving page and for offering your kind and generous donations to Shelter.

I wanted to provide some context behind why I am fundraising for
Shelter and how you can support me on my journey…

To run the London Marathon has been a goal of mine for years.
Running has been a real constant in my life, providing me with a positive release through loss, grief, stress, anxiety to highlighting some of my proudest moments of success and happiness. Nothing quite beats the euphoria of crossing the finish line, but for me the training process and the lead up to race day closely rivals it. I’ve always enjoyed the journey of getting there (wherever ‘there’ may be), with the aim of conquering some ‘small wins’ en route to the ‘big
win’.

And so…

Each month from October to April, I'll be tackling 7 different
races in 7 different areas of London, flying the flag for Shelter, with April's TCS 2023 London Marathon being the icing on the cake and the 7th and final race to celebrate all races. I've aptly named this challenge 'The Shelter 7.'

I'll be visualising this as a marathon sandwich, with two full
marathons bookending the challenge, stuffed with a hearty filling of three 10km events and two half marathons (listed below):

Oct - Richmond Marathon
Nov - Greenwich 10km
Dec - Victoria Park Half Marathon
Jan - Regents Park 10km
Feb - Wimbledon Half Marathon
Mar - Olympic Park 10km
Apr - London Marathon

If you’re reading this, thinking “bit much?”, let me explain…

I’m going that little bit BIGGER, because this whole cost of
living crisis is quite frankly making life that little bit TOUGHER for us all. I want to go the extra mile (or miles…) physically, to show how grateful I am for your donations during a time when we are all having to be that little bit more frugal!

Now more than ever Shelter need our support. Thousands of people are urgently trying to just get by without a safe place to call home. They’re trapped in damp, unfit accommodation, fighting to keep a roof over their family’s heads, or in unhygienic hostels, sleeping in
cars, tents or on sofas. Our country's housing emergency is spiralling. Every four minutes, even as you are reading this, another household becomes homeless. 

Being able to do something I love (by running) and at the same time champion those who have endured tough living conditions, support those battling housing difficulties now and try to make conditions better for those who may one day find themselves in this situation is an incredible feeling.

With April just around the corner, I’m ready for the
challenge and want to say thank you so much for your support.

Now off to pound the pavements of London…

Claire x

(T&Cs - Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. Therefore it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.)

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

On February 11th I will be dancing my socks off in Strictly Goes to the Movies at the Empress Ballroom, Blackpool to help raise funds for the charity Shelter.  

Shelter helps millions of people every year struggling with bad housing or homelessness through advice, support and legal services.
They’re here so no one has to fight bad housing or homelessness on their own.

For every £1 you donate:-

  • 79p is spent directly on helping people through advice, support and campaigning
  • 21p is spent on fundraising

Please donate whatever you can to help this worthy cause.

It will be an exciting and nerve racking event for me, with my love of dancing combined stage fright 🤣 So any donations will be greatly appreciated.  Thank you.

If you fancy watching tickets are available here and include welcome drink, 3 course meal and after show disco:-

https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/strictly-goes-to-the-movies-blackpool-registration-437139565207?utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&utm-medium=discovery&utm-term=listing&utm-source=cp&aff=escb

pageSummary: Supporting SHELTER helping those in crisis because Everyone is entitled to somewhere to feel safe
pageSummaryWhat: Supporting SHELTER helping those in crisis
pageSummaryWhy: Everyone is entitled to somewhere to feel safe
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Having only just completed my first ever Marathon, in London 2022, I am keen to keep up the momentum and continue doing something both as a deep personal achievement and for a great and essential cause. 

I'm running in the 2023 Schneider Electric Marathon De Paris on the 2nd April in support of SHELTER. 

Having felt the affects, as many of us have during this time of financial uncertainty, I am fortunate to have a safe space to call home, but there are many that don't.

It's said that anyone can be only 'two paychecks' away from homelessness, and to do something that in some small way can contribute to help those far less fortunate, is a real motivator to be deeply thankful for what I have and to raise funds for SHELTER who go out of their way to support those in crisis. 

Having somewhere to feel safe and secure is a human right, not a luxury, so please, if you are able, give what you can as I once again lace up my running shoes, take a few puffs on my inhaler and pound the streets of 'Gay Paree' to raise funds for SHELTER and help them continue their essential work the ensure that everyone has somewhere to call home, be it temporary accommodation, hostel or bedsit, everyone is entitled to feel safe.

thank you

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

£20 could pay for two calls through our emergency helpline.

£80 could pay for two face-to-face advice sessions.

£120 could pay for a legal advice session for someone facing housing problems.

£150 could help someone keep their home resolving a complex housing issue for them.

Thank you for making a big difference!

story:
Thank you for visiting my JustGiving page. Having spent many years interested in short distance triathlon and running, when the opportunity to run the London Marathon came my way, I thought it would be the perfect challenge to help raise money for a good cause.

The Challenge

The London Marathon is one of the biggest marathons in the world, making up 1 of the 6 World Marathon Majors. For many recreational runners, it is a bucket list item. The course takes us round the River Thames and past many London landmarks. Totalling 42.2km, this will be a great test of mental strength as to date, the furthest I have run is 10km.

The Charity

Having a home is a basic human right but the harsh reality is, not everyone gets to experience that right. Shelter exists to defend the right to a safe home. They provide one-to-one support services, a free emergency helpline as well as other options available online or through legal advice. If you’d like to learn more, you can visit their website here: https://england.shelter.org.uk/

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

At Shelter, they understand more than most about the effects of the cost of living crisis. They are taking calls every day from people worried about being evicted, not being able to afford their rent, or having to choose between eating or heating. Fundraising enables them to fight for the right to a safe home for everyone. This winter will be tough for us all but even more so for those less fortunate than us so please help me raise as much as possible to help Shelter support as many people as possible.

charity.description: Our mission is to transform the quality of life for donkeys, mules and people worldwide through greater understanding, collaboration and support. We want a world where donkeys and mules live free from suffering and their contribution to humanity is fully valued.
charity.name: The Donkey Sanctuary
story:
On the 14th October we lost lovely Lynnie.

In Memory of Lynne, Len and her family would welcome charitable donations to Lynne’s favourite charity The Donkey Sanctuary in Devon, a charitable foundation that Lynne supported and sponsored and visited. A life long animal lover, we thought that this would be a fitting tribute to our lovely Wife, Sister and Auntie.

Your kind donation is an amazing way to honour and remember Lynne, ensuring her memory lives on by transforming the lives of donkeys and communities across the world every single day.Your gift helps provide safe and loving homes for life for abandoned and abused animals rescued in the UK and Ireland. Overseas, your kindness makes a life-saving difference to donkeys and mules working with some of the worlds poorest communities. Its a wonderful way to both pay tribute to Lynne and support the rights of abused, neglected and abandoned donkeys across the world.

Thank you for your kindness.

❤️ Len ❤️

🐴 Sue&Richard 🐴 Anne&Brian 🐴 Philip 

🐴 Kate,Mark&Jack🐴
title: In Loving Memory of Lynne Wilders
image.caption: NA
media.images.image.caption: So much more than an Auntie, I will miss you so much. Love you, Kate xxx
rememberedPersonSummary.name: Lynne Wilders

charity.description: Our mission is to transform the quality of life for donkeys, mules and people worldwide through greater understanding, collaboration and support. We want a world where donkeys and mules live free from suffering and their contribution to humanity is fully valued.
charity.name: The Donkey Sanctuary
pageSummary: Raising both funds and awareness because Donkey’s need support too
story:
Thank you for taking the time to visit my fundraising page.

For those of you who know me well you know that over the last few years Running has become a passion. You will also know that I love a challenge and in April 2023 I will be running the London Marathon in support of The Donkey Sanctuary.


The Donkey Sanctuary is doing important work both here in the U.K. and worldwide with the aim of improving the welfare of Donkey’s who are facing ever greater challenges on a daily basis.

Indeed I myself never realised that each year approximately 4.8million Donkey’s are slaughtered for their skins. The collagen taken from their skin is used in the production of ejiao an ingredient used in the production of traditional Chinese medicine.

There are many charities out there which are all equally deserving of our support but I hope you will join me in trying to make a difference, in whatever small way we can, for Donkeys everywhere.

I would a!so urge you to visit www.thedonkeysanctuary.org.uk for further information and also to see the cute residents currently being cared for at the various centres in the U.K.  In fact whilst there why not adopt a Donkey of your very own!

Thank you again.

Philip

charity.description: Médecins Sans Frontières / Doctors Without Borders (MSF) is the world's leading medical humanitarian aid organisation. We work in over 70 countries - in conflict zones, natural disasters and epidemics. We are independent, neutral and impartial. We provide medical care where it's needed most.
charity.name: Medecins Sans Frontieres / Doctors Without Borders (MSF)
story:
Due to my freedom and just pure luck I have been afforded the privilege of being able seek out my own discomfort and challenge. I get to do things like run a 100 mile ultra-marathon just because...

However, for millions of people discomfort and pain is not a choice. It is simply thrust on them. Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) / Doctors without Borders provide medical assistance to people affected by conflict, epidemics, disasters, or exclusion from healthcare. 

They offer assistance to people based on need. It doesn’t matter which country they are from, which religion they belong to, or what their political affiliations are. They give priority to those in the most serious and immediate danger.

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.description: Médecins Sans Frontières / Doctors Without Borders (MSF) is the world's leading medical humanitarian aid organisation. We work in over 70 countries - in conflict zones, natural disasters and epidemics. We are independent, neutral and impartial. We provide medical care where it's needed most.
charity.name: Medecins Sans Frontieres / Doctors Without Borders (MSF)
pageSummary: WR attempt for furthest distance rowed in 24 hours
pageSummaryWhat: WR attempt for furthest distance rowed in 24 hours
story:
Throughout my upbringing in the middle-east, I have been neighboured by a number of humanitarian crises. This has led to my postgraduate study in Global Health at St. Georges University. Understanding the work of MSF who are known as 'Doctors Without Borders', and the incredible difference they make on a global scale has inspired me...

I hope to raise £1500 (distance from St. Georges Hospital to Kyiv) for this truly worthy cause by beating the world record for the furthest distance rowed in 24 hours (In my category). I will also complete the entire row outdoors; this is in an attempt to understand the harsh weather that displaced persons are subjected to in a humanitarian crisis. This is a common ongoing situation in Ukraine, where MSF has a critical presence. 

Any donations to this cause will not only be greatly appreciated but will also aid Médecins Sans Frontières, supporting them in having a lasting impact by providing medical assistance in humanitarian emergencies across the globe.
title: Will's 24 Hour World-Record Row For MSF
